snippet: The Benghazi crisis has been the biggest challenge in the first civilian job held by David H. Petraeus, who has gotten high marks in a markedly different culture from that of the military.
abstract: CIA director David H Petraeus' distaste for attention has won praise for the agency and eased former tensions with Pres Obama, but has also created difficulties in wake of attack that killed four Americans in Benghazi, Libya; long held secrecy about the CIA's presence there has left a void that has been filled by news media and Congressional furor over whether the deaths could have been prevented.
lead_paragraph: The Benghazi crisis has been the biggest challenge in the first civilian job held by David H. Petraeus, who has gotten high marks in a markedly different culture from that of the military.

headline.seo: Petraeus’s Lower C.I.A. Profile Leaves Benghazi Void
headline.main:
Petraeus’s Quieter
